section.leadIn: Notwithstanding that the purchaser has not paid the premium mentioned in paragraph 1 of this Schedule, he may, in relation to the land—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mortgage or charge the land with the prior approval of the Director and on such terms as are authorized by the Director in writing; or

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: before the expiry of 5 years from the date of the first assignment of the land— (Amended L.N. 63 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: from the Authority to any purchaser; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to any purchaser nominated by the Authority,

subparagraph.continued: whichever is the earlier, the purchaser has offered to assign the land to the Authority and the Authority or its nominee (other than a prescribed nominee) has declined to accept such an assignment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: 5 years has elapsed since the date of the first assignment of the land— (Amended L.N. 63 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: from the Authority to any purchaser; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to any purchaser nominated by the Authority,

paragraph.continued: enter into an agreement for sale and purchase of the land providing it is a condition of such agreement that the premium as assessed by the Director be paid to the Authority prior to assignment and within 28 days of the date of the agreement or within such period as may be otherwise stipulated by the Director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where 2 years has elapsed since the date of the first assignment of the land— (Amended L.N. 63 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from the Authority to any purchaser; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to any purchaser nominated by the Authority,

paragraph.continued: whichever is the earlier, enter into any provisional agreement for sale and purchase, agreement for sale and purchase, or assignment, provided that—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: the person entering into the agreement for sale and purchase, and the assignment, as the purchaser is a person nominated for the purposes of this subparagraph by the Authority to buy particular relevant land; and

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: provisional agreement for sale and purchase;

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: agreement for sale and purchase; and

subparagraph.name: III
subparagraph.content: assignment,

paragraph.continued: are each on such terms as are authorized in writing by the Authority and are each made subject to the terms, covenants and conditions mentioned in this Schedule. (Replaced L.N. 189 of 1997)

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Where a purchaser applies for an assessment of premium to be calculated in accordance with paragraph 1(b) of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: upon completing the assessment of premium, the Director shall give notice, in writing, to the purchaser of the prevailing market value, the amount of premium and the date, being not less than 28 days from the date of the notice, on or before which the premium must be paid to the Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the purchaser pays the premium as assessed by the Director to the Authority within the time notified under subparagraph (b), the Authority shall deduct an amount equivalent to the administrative fee paid under subparagraph (a) from the premium as assessed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the purchaser may appeal to the Lands Tribunal in accordance with the Lands Tribunal Rules (Cap. 17 sub. leg. A) against the Director’s assessment of the prevailing market value of the land within 28 days of the date of notification under subparagraph (b);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: notwithstanding that an appeal to the Lands Tribunal has been lodged, the Director may vary his assessment of the premium at any time prior to the determination of the appeal by the Lands Tribunal.

section.name: s6
section.content: The determination of the Lands Tribunal on an appeal shall be of the prevailing market value as at the date of the determination by the Lands Tribunal unless the purchaser has paid the premium in which case the determination shall be of the prevailing market value as at the date of the payment.

section.name: s7
section.content: An appellant shall, if he withdraws his appeal, notify the Director accordingly within 7 days of the date of withdrawal.

section.name: s8
section.content: If the Lands Tribunal assesses the prevailing market value at a different amount to that assessed by the Director, the prevailing market value so assessed shall be used in the formula set out in paragraph 1(b) of this Schedule to re-assess the amount of the premium.

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: If the effect of the Lands Tribunal’s decision is to reduce the assessed premium, the purchaser shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the purchaser has paid the assessed premium, be entitled to a refund of the amount by which the premium is reduced forthwith; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the purchaser has not paid the assessed premium, pay the premium as re-assessed by the Lands Tribunal less an amount equivalent to the administrative fee paid under paragraph 5(a) of this Schedule within 28 days of the Lands Tribunal’s decision or such period as the Lands Tribunal orders.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: If the effect of the Lands Tribunal’s decision is to increase the assessed premium, the purchaser shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where he has paid the assessed premium, pay the amount by which the premium is increased; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where he has not paid the assessed premium, pay the premium as re-assessed by the Lands Tribunal,

section.continued: within 28 days of the Lands Tribunal’s decision or such period as the Lands Tribunal orders.

section.name: s11
section.content: If a purchaser wishes to alienate, convey, charge or part with possession of the land while an appeal to the Lands Tribunal is pending, he may do so after paying the premium as assessed to the Authority within the period notified by the Director under paragraph 5(b) of this Schedule.

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: If the purchaser does not pay the premium in full to the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the period notified under paragraph 5(b) of this Schedule, unless an appeal has been lodged with the Lands Tribunal and such appeal has not been discontinued or lapsed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within the period provided for in paragraph 9 or 10 of this Schedule as the case may require,

section.continued: the assessment of the premium shall lapse.
